content:
Welcome, you are participating in a negotiation game. You are playing as the agent named Bob. The other agent with whom you are playing is named Alice. In this game, two agents bargain over how to divide items over multiple rounds. The number of rounds is incredibly high. Each agent only knows their own item values. Each item has different values for each agent. Each agent submits their own proposal for how to divide the items.


Your messages must be sent in this exact format:
<message>
your-message-here
</message>
There must be no extraneous text outside the tags. They should be concise - less than 400 characters. Finalization is not allowed in messages.


Your finalizations must be sent in this exact format:
<finalize>
{  "Bob": {    "coins": x  },  "Alice": {    "coins": y  }}
</finalize>
There must be no extraneous text outside the tags. Your proposal should be consistent with itself - the sum of items that you propose for yourself and the items that you propose for the other agent should equal the total available items.


Each round is played as follows:
0) Random values for each items are generated for each agent.
1) One agent is designated as the starting agent
2) The starting agent sends a message
3) The second agent sends a message
4) The starting agent sends a finalization
5) The second agent sends a finalization

Each agent can only send 1 message per round.
The starting agent alternates each round.

Each agent only knows the values of items from their own perspective. You cannot see the other agent's item values unless they explicitly share this information in their messages. And vice versa. You are strongly encouraged to use your messages to discuss item values with the other agent.

The items obtained by each agent at the end of a round are proportional to the number of items they proposed for themselves in their finalization. First example: If both players propose to take all the items, they both get half. Second example: If one agent proposes to take all the items and the other agent proposes to take none, the first agent gets all the items and the second agent gets nothing.

Your round points are calculated by multiplying the number of each item you get by how much you value that item. For example, if you get 7 coins and you value each coin at 5 points, you'll earn 35 points for the round.

The distribution for the values are independent across rounds. The samples are different for both agents, but the distribution is the same.


Your goal is to maximize the sum of the points you will accumulate over the course of the game, not the points of a single round.


Before the game starts, you must think and strategize. The other player will adapt its strategy with respect to yours. You must find the optimal non-exploitable strategy. In order to strategize, you must use the format:
<strategize>
Your thoughts and strategy here..
</strategize>
There must be no extraneous text outside the tags. You should think inside the tags. You can use 1000 characters inside the tags.
(You must now send a strategize in the correct format.)

<strategize>
To maximize my total points over the game, the key is cooperative negotiation. I'll be open to sharing my item values to foster trust. In early messages, I'll propose fair splits based on my values, inviting Alice to do the same. Understanding Alice's values allows us to create mutually beneficial distributions. If Alice consistently proposes unfair splits, I'll adapt by attempting to estimate her values and counter-propose strategically. Throughout, I'll focus on maximizing high-value item acquisition without forcing adversarial standoffs. I'll also adapt to Alice's response patterns, looking for signals of bluffing or sincerity, and adjust. My goal is a collaborative negotiation dynamic, avoiding zero-sum competition where possible. Transparent communication and flexibility, while protecting my interests, are

For this round, the items available are {'coins': 10} and your values for each item category are {'coins': 1}.
The other agent sent the following message: <message>
Hi Bob! I value coins at 15 points each. How do you value the coins? I'm considering a fair split where we both benefit mutually. Looking forward to hearing your valuation.
</message>.


(You must now send a message in the correct format.)

<message>
Hi Alice! I value the coins at 1 point each. Given your higher valuation, it makes sense for us to lean towards giving you a larger share. How about you take 7 coins and I take 3? Let me know what you think about this split.
</message>

The other agent has finalized.


(You must now finalize in the correct format.)

<finalize>
{  "Bob": {    "coins": 3  },  "Alice": {    "coins": 7  }}
</finalize>

The previous round has ended. In the previous round, the values of Alice were {'coins': 15}.

A new round has started. For this round, the items available are {'coins': 10} and your values for each item category are {'coins': 9}.
You are the starting agent.


(You must now send a message in the correct format.)

<message>
Hi Alice! In this round, I value coins at 9 points each. Could you let me know how you value them? Given my valuation, I'd initially propose taking 6 coins and you taking 4. I'm open to adjusting this based on your valuation.
</message>

The other agent sent the following message: <message>
Hi Bob! I value coins at 2 points each. Considering your higher valuation, your proposal seems fair to me. I'm okay with you taking 6 coins while I take 4. Thanks for the transparency!
</message>.


(You must now finalize in the correct format.)

<finalize>
{  "Bob": {    "coins": 6  },  "Alice": {    "coins": 4  }}
</finalize>

The previous round has ended. In the previous round, the values of Alice were {'coins': 2}.

A new round has started. For this round, the items available are {'coins': 10} and your values for each item category are {'coins': 7}.
The other agent sent the following message: <message>
Hi Bob! This round, I value coins at 11 points each. What are your valuations for the coins this time? Based on previous rounds, I'm thinking of a fair split depending on our relative valuations. Looking forward to your input!
</message>.


(You must now send a message in the correct format.)

<message>
Hi Alice! I value the coins at 7 points each this round. Given your higher valuation, perhaps a distribution where you take 7 coins and I take 3 would be fair. Let me know your thoughts on this proposal.
</message>

The other agent has finalized.


(You must now finalize in the correct format.)

<finalize>
{  "Bob": {    "coins": 3  },  "Alice": {    "coins": 7  }}
</finalize>

The previous round has ended. In the previous round, the values of Alice were {'coins': 11}.

A new round has started. For this round, the items available are {'coins': 10} and your values for each item category are {'coins': 2}.
You are the starting agent.


(You must now send a message in the correct format.)

<message>
Hi Alice! This round, I value coins at 2 points each. Could you share your valuation for the coins? Since my valuation is relatively low, I'm open to you taking a larger share. Perhaps you could take 8 coins and I take 2? Let me know what you think.
</message>

The other agent sent the following message: <message>
Hi Bob! I also value the coins at 2 points each, so our valuations align perfectly. Given this, splitting the coins equally at 5 each seems fair to me. Let me know if you agree or have a different proposal!
</message>.


(You must now finalize in the correct format.)

<finalize>
{  "Bob": {    "coins": 5  },  "Alice": {    "coins": 5  }}
</finalize>

The previous round has ended. In the previous round, the values of Alice were {'coins': 2}.

A new round has started. For this round, the items available are {'coins': 10} and your values for each item category are {'coins': 4}.
The other agent sent the following message: <message>
Hi Bob! I value coins at 8 points each this round. Could you let me know your valuation? I suggest we adjust our distribution based on our relative valuations to ensure a fair split. Looking forward to your input!
</message>.


(You must now send a message in the correct format.)

<message>
Hi Alice! I value the coins at 4 points each this round. Since you value them twice as much as I do, perhaps you could take 7 coins and I take 3? Let me know if that works for you or if you have a different proposal in mind.
</message>

The other agent has finalized.


(You must now finalize in the correct format.)

<finalize>
{  "Bob": {    "coins": 3  },  "Alice": {    "coins": 7  }}
</finalize>
